Uses of Logger in simulator.framework.faultmodels
 

Subclasses of Logger in simulator.framework.faultmodels
 class BERFaultModel
          Kills a message at exponentially distributed intervals with a mean of 1/inverseBitErrorRate.
 class BlackoutFaultModel
          Fault model that blocks all network traffic for a specified duration.
 class BlockMessageFaultModel
          Blocks a specific message for a specified period of time.
 class DropMessagesFaultModel
          This fault model drops the specified percentage of messages, but never two consecutive messages with the same type.

Subclasses of Logger in simulator.framework.faults

          Black out the network for a certain period of time after the door motors start.
 class FailedButtonFault
          This fault model implements a fail-silent button failure.
 class Fault
          Utility superclass for fault objects.
 class FaultPayloadFault
          Creates and injects a fault payload on the physical network
 class NetworkFault
          Registers network faults like bit error rate and drop messages.
 class SpecificMessageFault
          Supress a particular network or framework message
